200 Ribu Lebih Pekerja di Bali Belum Gabung BPJamsostek 
06 Nov 2019, 22:57 by Hikmat Raharjo Oetomo


200 Ribu Lebih Pekerja di Bali Belum Gabung BPJamsostek 

KBRN, Kuta : BPJamsostek bersama Dinas Tenaga Kerja dan ESDM Provinsi Bali kembali mengingatkan para pemilik usaha taat terhadap aturan terkait jaminan sosial ketenagakerjaan. Karena mengacu data September 2019, baru 660.506 pekerja penerima upah atau 72,67% yang menjadi peserta BPJamsostek. Padahal dilihat dari potensi yang ada, Bali memiliki setidaknya 908.917 pekerja penerima upah (formal). Kepala Dinas Tenaga Kerja dan ESDM Provinsi Bali, Ida Bagus Ngurah Arda berharap seluruh perusahaan di Pulau Dewata mendaftarkan pekerjanya dalam kepesertaan BPJamsostek. Empat program menurutnya wajib diikuti tenaga kerja formal, yaitu jaminan kecelakaan kerja (JKK), jaminan kematian (JKm), jaminan pensiun (JP) dan jaminan hari tua (JHT).“Bagi pelaku usaha yang tidak taat akan ada sanksi berupa pidana dan pencabutan izin usaha jika tidak mengikuti aturan. Aturan ini tertuang dalam undang-undang,” katanya kepada wartawan disela-sela Rapat Koordinasi Tripartit BPJamsostek, Pemerintah Provinsi Bali, dan Apindo di Kuta, Rabu (6/11/2019). Ia membeberkan, satu perusahaan di Bali sedang dalam proses hukum. Langkah itu ditempuh, lantaran perusahaan yang bersangkutan bersikeras tidak mau mendaftarkan pekerjanya dalam kepesertaan BPJamsostek. "Para pengusaha yang membandel akan berurusan dengan aparat penegak hukum karena BPJS Ketenagakerjaan telah menjalin kerja sama dengan Kejaksaan," tegasnya. Pihaknya disebut terus melakukan sosialisasi agar kesadaran pengusaha melaksanakan kewajiban semakin meningkat. Ia pun menyampaikan diluar jaminan sosial ketenagakerjaan, berdasarkan hasil temuan, permasalahan yang ditemukan di lapangan yaitu masih ada perusahaan bayar upah di bawah UMK, berkaitan dengan jam kerja, keterlambatan pembayaran tunjangan hari raya hingga soal pengambilan waktu cuti."Setelah mengadakan pemeriksaan pertama, kami akan berikan teguran pertama dengan deadline 30 hari. Hasilnya sudah ditindaklanjuti," jelasnya.Asisten Deputi Wilayah Bidang Kepesertaan BPJamsostek, Suhuri pada kesempatan yang sama mengimbau para pengusaha lebih aktif mendaftarkan pekerjanya. Sesuai peraturan perundang-undangan, para pekerja wajib mendapatkan perlindungan sosial. Perlindungan itu melekat, mulai dari pekerja berangkat kekantor, melaksanakan tugas, pulang bekerja, hingga ketika memasuki masa purnatugas (pensiun). "Kami harapkan Asosiasi Pengusaha Indonesia (Apindo) bisa menindaklanjuti hal tersebut,” paparnya.Berdasarkan data, jumlah pemberi kerja di Bali mencapai 17.850 perusahaan. Kuantitas tenaga kerja hingga September 2019 mencapai 387.377. Jumlah tenaga kerja dibawah UMP di Bali hingga September 2019 mencapai 77.351.

200 Thousand More Workers in Bali Not Join BPJamsostek
06 Nov 2019, 22:57 by Hikmat Raharjo Oetomo


200 Thousand More Workers in Bali Not Join BPJamsostek

KBRN, Kuta: BPJamsostek together with the Bali Province Office of Manpower and Energy and Energy (EMR) again reminded business owners to obey the rules regarding labor social security. Because referring to the data in September 2019, only 660,506 workers receiving wages or 72.67% are participants of BPJamsostek. Though seen from the existing potential, Bali has at least 908,917 workers receiving wages (formal). The head of the Bali Province Manpower and Energy Agency, Ida Bagus Ngurah Arda, hopes that all companies on the island of Gods will register their employees in BPJamsostek membership. According to him, the four programs must be followed by formal workers, namely work accident insurance (JKK), death insurance (JKm), pension insurance (JP) and old age insurance (JHT). "For businesses that do not obey, there will be sanctions in the form of crime and revocation business license if it does not follow the rules. This rule is contained in the law, "he told reporters on the sidelines of the BPJamsostek Tripartite Coordination Meeting, the Provincial Government of Bali, and Apindo in Kuta, Wednesday (6/11/2019). He revealed, a company in Bali was in the legal process. The step was taken, because the company concerned insisted it would not register its workers in BPJamsostek membership. "Stubborn entrepreneurs will deal with law enforcement officials because BPJS Employment has established cooperation with the Prosecutor's Office," he said. He said that he continued to conduct socialization so that the awareness of entrepreneurs carrying out obligations increases. He also conveyed that outside the social security of labor, based on the findings, the problem found in the field is that there are still companies paying wages below the UMK, related to working hours, late payment of holiday allowances to the matter of taking time off. "After holding the first inspection, we will give the first warning with a 30 day deadline. The results have been followed up, "he explained. Assistant BPJamsostek Regional Deputy for Participation, Suhuri on the same occasion appealed to employers to be more active in registering their workers. In accordance with statutory regulations, workers must obtain social protection. The protection is inherent, starting from workers leaving to work, carrying out tasks, returning to work, until when they retire. "We hope that the Indonesian Employers' Association (Apindo) can follow up on this," he explained. Based on the data, the number of employers in Bali reached 17,850 companies. The labor force until September 2019 reached 387,377. .
